column4: Hi, why would Ubuntu newer than 8.04 fail to burn properly, when the ISO's MD5 is correct and the CD passed the burning program's check?
did you burn as slow as you could?
Should I try burning at a low speed?
if the cd passes consistancy check and the image md5s ok then you have a good ubuntu cd
override it and burn at 8 or 4 which may help
sweet, yeah most systems dont like CDs burned too fast, plus you get a better burn at lower speeds
makes sense. thats why i never get these drives that do huge speeds
it will be in the livecd environment.
in large partitions you may want to reduce the percentage used as it can start getting massive
yeah, on 2Tb partitions it is a large chunk of space
if the nautilus makes it run: add it to your startup items
